stories.headline: BREAKING: Wolverines penalty!
stories.bodyText:
The NCAA tacked on a third suspension game for Moore ‚Äî forcing Michigan to navigate a critical September stretch without its head coach.

Michigan opens with New Mexico before a marquee Sept. 9 matchup at Oklahoma ‚Äî a Big Ten vs. SEC clash that now looms even larger without Moore on the sideline.

stories.headline: Oh, it's you AGAIN!
stories.bodyText:
Anthony Davis, now with the Mavericks, will play his first game back in LA on Nov. 28

The Davis-Donƒçiƒá swap happened mere hours after the Lakers played at Madison Square Garden last season, adding a layer of ‚Äúonly in the NBA‚Äù chaos to the saga.

stories.headline: Dodgers descent
stories.bodyText:
After being swept by the Angels, the Dodgers fell out of first for the first time since April 27, now chasing a surging Padres team.

The Padres haven‚Äôt held sole possession of first this late in the season since September 25, 2010.

stories.headline: Manning Money
stories.bodyText:
Wait to see draft order and team situations before deciding

NFL scouts expect the Mannings to weigh which team holds the No. 1 pick, who the coach is, and overall fit ‚Äî and with NIL money, there‚Äôs no rush to enter the league.

stories.headline: Caitlin's fever
stories.bodyText:
Clark has been sidelined for 19 of the Fever‚Äôs 32 games, including her latest stretch out with a groin injury suffered on July 15.

Despite missing Clark, the Fever are 10-9 without her and 6-2 over their last eight games.

stories.headline: Was it worth it?
stories.bodyText:
Nine out of 10 former players ‚Äî even many who said football wrecked their bodies and minds ‚Äî said they‚Äôd do it all over again because the game gave them money, fame, and life-defining moments.

One player said he‚Äôd play again despite an early Alzheimer‚Äôs diagnosis, because the competition and camaraderie were worth it.
